intro: Isexina, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Isexina has a short flowering period in early spring and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, aiding in its natural spread.
